Question: This person believed that political success at home depended on the success of the French army in Europe.
Hints: This person's youngest daughter Lucy died of whooping cough in 1785 in the United States, and he was bereft.
Though the resolutions followed the "interposition" approach of Madison, this person advocated nullification.
This person viewed English colonists were compelled to rely on "common sense" and rediscover the "laws of nature".
